title: Recover Faster: Combining Electrolytes with Ayurvedic Adaptogens
author: Harish
excerpt: Electrolytes restore balance, while adaptogens like ashwagandha support recovery. Learn timing, hydration tips, and how to use recovery drinks wisely.
content:
The Two Pillars of Recovery

After exercise you need: 1) fluid and electrolyte restoration and 2) metabolic reset. Electrolytes (sodium, potassium) stop cramping and dizziness; adaptogens like ashwagandha provide broader resilience and recovery support.

When to Use a Recovery Drink

  • After prolonged exercise (>45–60 minutes) or when sweating heavily.
  • During hot-weather training or multi-session days.
  • As part of immediate post-workout refueling paired with a small protein snack.

Practical Tips

  • Mix in 300–500 ml water and sip slowly.
  • Avoid overconsumption of electrolytes if you have medical restrictions.
  • Pair with light recovery foods—banana, yogurt, or a small nut snack.
